name: Ehrenpreis conjecture
rephrased: Any two closed surfaces with genus at least 2 have finite covers that are geometrically very similar, differing only slightly in distortion.
implication_form: If S and T are any two closed Riemann surfaces of genus at least 2, then there exist finite-degree covers of S and T and a diffeomorphism between these covers with small distortion.
posed_by: Ehrenpreis (attributed to him, exact proposer not specified in the query)
year_originated: around 60 years ago (estimated based on context)
explained: The Ehrenpreis conjecture states that any two closed Riemann surfaces of genus at least 2 admit finite-degree covers that are geometrically close. Geometrically close means there exists a diffeomorphism between them with bounded distortion (small stretching). This conjecture was proven by Jeremy Kahn and Vladimir Markovic in 2012, making it a theorem. The theorem establishes a strong connection between any two such surfaces by showing their finite covers can be made arbitrarily close in their geometric properties.
